result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C. Hawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant must complete the Substance Abuse Progam first before the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.

Obtain/maintain full time employment or combination of education and employment equivalent to being occupied full time.

Employment to be in an occupation acceptable to agent.  May not voluntarily quit employment without agent approval.

Obtain and maintain housing approved by agent.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and take prescribed medications as prescribed.

No drug paraphernalia.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores.

Complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations per agent.

Obey all no contact orders made by agent.

Complete Thinking for a Change if agent deems appropriate.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Pay extradition costs in the amount of $816.20.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence now serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
